embed.title: cowsay
embed.description: Runs 'cowsay' in the host. Is protected from your 'sudo rm -r's

fields.name: <message>
fields.value: Generates an ASCII image of a cow with a message

fields.name: -n
fields.value: Disables word wrap, allowing the cow to speak FIGlet or to display other embedded ASCII art. Width in columns becomes that of the longest line, ignoring any value of `-W`.

fields.name: -W
fields.value: Specifies width of the speech balloon in columns, i.e. characters in a monospace font. Default value is 40.

fields.name: -b
fields.value: “Borg mode”, uses == in place of oo for the cow′s eyes.

fields.name: -d
fields.value: “Dead”, uses XX, plus a descending U to represent an extruded tongue, also used on Linux kernel oops.

fields.name: -s
fields.value: “Stoned”, uses ** to represent bloodshot eyes, plus a descending U to represent an extruded tongue.

fields.name: -e <string>
fields.value: Manually specifies the cow′s eye-type, e.g. `cowsay -e ^^`

fields.name: -t <string>
fields.value: Manually specifies the cow′s tongue shape, e.g. `cowsay -T \(\)` for a pair of parentheses.

fields.name: -f <cowfile>
fields.value: Specifies a .cow file from which to load alternative ASCII art. Accepts both absolute file-paths and those relative to the environment nameiable `COWPATH`.

fields.name: -l
fields.value: Lists the names of available cow-files in the `COWPATH` directory instead of displaying a quote.
